title: Rampant Land Disputes and Fraud
summary: Land-related disputes constitute over 70% of civil cases in Bangladesh courts, with fraudulent documents and multiple claims causing widespread injustice.
currentSituation: Bangladesh lacks a comprehensive digital land registry. Paper-based records are susceptible to forgery, and the process of verifying land ownership is time-consuming, expensive, and prone to corruption. An estimated 4 million land-related cases are pending in courts.
affectedGroups: Low-income families vulnerable to land grabbing
consequences: Billions of taka lost in legal fees annually
Violence and deaths over land disputes
Erosion of trust in legal system
potentialTechInterventions: Mobile app for land record verification
relatedResources: World Bank Report on Land Administration in Bangladesh
Transparency International Bangladesh Land Governance Study
